INDICATOR: Percent of people 65 and above who consume fruit at least once a day, less than once per week, 1 to 3 times a week, 4 to 6 times a week, never consume fruit
notes TB:
Regarding indicators for fruit and vegetables - the national dietary recommendation is to consume 5 or more protions of fruit and vegetables per day - suggest sticking with this national dietary recommendation and therefore the indicators HIS33C01 (5 portions or more of fruit/day) and HIS39C01 (5 or more portions of vegetables/day) would need to be combined.   While separating out fruit consumption from vegetable consumption is of interest to niche audiences such as 'Dietitians', I think having one indicator to represent a national dietary recommendation is more important.  
The indicator might be 'Daily consumption of five or more fruits and vegetables by age and gender (%)'

INDICATOR: The percent of the population aged 65 and older who are employed or actively seeking employment
PREP MEETING NOTES: May be difficult for the everyday user to interpret. Ob from the statistician responsible for the LFS - the rates we produce are defined by the ILO so the 15% is for anyone 65 and over in this case, 1% is 65-74 year olds while there is no employment rate for 65+ as they are not in the parameters of the statistic. The actual employment number in the table is not limited by the ILO so it will refer to all over 65 year olds for Labour Force, Employment and Unemployment. - PES statistics in the demographics may be more relevant
notes SC: May be difficult for the everyday user to interpret. Ob from the statistician responsible for the LFS - the rates we produce are defined by the ILO so the 15% is for anyone 65 and over in this case, 1% is 65-74 year olds while there is no employment rate for 65+ as they are not in the parameters of the statistic. The actual employment number in the table is not limited by the ILO so it will refer to all over 65 year olds for Labour Force, Employment and Unemployment. - PES statistics in the demographics may be more relevant
